section.title: Overview
section.p: The Members page in Oxygen Content Fusion allows organization administrators to manage user access, assign roles, and allocate licenses within their organization. This page provides a centralized interface for viewing and controlling all members, their roles, and license usage.

section.title: License Allocation
section.p: At the top of the page, you can view how your license seats are allocated. Two progress bars display the current usage of your organization's licenses:

dlentry.dd: Shows the number of Author licenses used out of the total available
Shows the number of Subject-Matter Expert licenses used out of the total available

section.p: This helps administrators monitor license consumption and plan for future needs.

section.title: Pending Invitations
section.p: This section allows you to invite new members to your organization.

dlentry.dd: Enter the email address of the person you wish to invite.
Choose the user role (e.g., Subject-Matter Expert) for the invitee.

section.p: Pending invitations are listed below the input fields, showing:

ul.li: The option to cancel the invitation (close button)

section.p: When inviting an user, you need to specify what role they will have. A license seat is automatically allocated when you invite the user even before the user signs up in the organization.

section.title: Members List
section.p: This section displays all current members of the organization, including the following details:

dlentry.dd: The member’s name and email address.
The member’s role at the organization level (e.g., Admin, Member).
An Administrator has access to the organization management page and can perform various actions such as assigning other administrators, managing organization members, or managing the subscription.
The member’s role within the platform (e.g., Author, Subject-Matter Expert).

Indicates whether the user is currently active.
Inactive users cannot log in, do not count against license seat limits, but their data remains intact. An administrator can reactivate them at any time.
Use the dropdown menus to change a member’s organization-level role or user role.
Use the checkbox to activate or deactivate a member.

Click the three-dot menu for additional actions
Anonymize user This action removes user data. It is irreversible and can only be performed on users who are already inactive. anonymizes the user data stored in the database, but does not anonymize data stored in Git repositories (both stored internally by Content Fusion and linked repositories).
Delete user This action permanently removes the user from the system.
